definitions: person who rides on the surface of ocean waves on a surfboard for sport or recreation
examples: The experienced surfer paddled out to catch the biggest waves
Several surfers gathered at dawn waiting for perfect conditions

definitions: sport or activity of riding on the surface of ocean waves while standing or lying on a surfboard
examples: Surfing requires good balance and understanding of ocean conditions
She took up surfing during her vacation in Hawaii

definitions: sudden powerful forward or upward movement especially of water or electricity
sudden large increase in amount or intensity of something
examples: A surge of water crashed over the seawall during the storm
The power surge damaged several electronic devices in the building
The company experienced a surge in sales during the holiday season
There was a surge of interest in renewable energy solutions

definitions: thought or idea based on incomplete evidence or without proof of its accuracy
examples: His surmise about the cause of the problem proved to be correct
Based on the evidence, their surmise was that someone had entered during the night

definitions: hereditary name shared by members of a family that comes after personal names
examples: Please write your surname on the form after your first name
The surname Johnson is one of the most common in English-speaking countries

definitions: twentieth century artistic and literary movement that sought to express the unconscious mind through dreamlike imagery and unexpected juxtapositions
examples: Salvador Dali became one of the most famous artists associated with surrealism
The painting displayed typical elements of surrealism with its melting clocks and distorted landscapes

definitions: artist or writer who creates works in the style of surrealism using dreamlike imagery
examples: The surrealist painted impossible scenes that challenged viewers' perceptions
Many surrealists gathered in Paris during the 1920s and 1930s

definitions: act of giving up control or possession especially after fighting or resisting
examples: The general signed the document of surrender to end the conflict
Their surrender came after weeks of negotiations between the parties

definitions: light four-wheeled horse-drawn carriage with two or four seats
county in southeastern England bordering Greater London
examples: The family rode through the park in an old-fashioned surrey
A surrey with the fringe on top appeared in many early American films
Surrey is known for its rolling hills and historic market towns
Many London commuters choose to live in Surrey for its countryside

definitions: person or thing that takes the place of another especially in a specific role or function
examples: The aunt served as a surrogate mother after the children's parents died
The artificial sweetener acts as a surrogate for sugar in many recipes

definitions: capital and largest city of Nepal located in a valley in the Himalayas
examples: Tourists often use Kathmandu as a base for trekking expeditions
The ancient temples of Kathmandu attract visitors from around the world

definitions: member of a Turkic people native to Kazakhstan and surrounding regions
Turkic language spoken by the Kazakh people primarily in Kazakhstan
examples: The Kazakh nomads traditionally lived in portable yurts on the steppes
Many Kazakh families still maintain their traditional customs and celebrations
She studied Kazakh to better communicate with her host family
Kazakh uses a modified Cyrillic alphabet in Kazakhstan

definitions: largest landlocked country in the world located in Central Asia and Eastern Europe
examples: Kazakhstan gained independence from the Soviet Union in 1991
The vast steppes of Kazakhstan stretch for thousands of kilometers

definitions: person who is a citizen or native of Kazakhstan regardless of ethnic background
examples: The Kazakhstani delegation presented their proposal at the international conference
Many Kazakhstanis speak both Kazakh and Russian fluently

definitions: base unit of thermodynamic temperature in the International System of Units starting from absolute zero
examples: Water freezes at 273.15 kelvin under standard atmospheric pressure
Scientists often use kelvin when measuring extremely cold temperatures

definitions: of or relating to the English county of Kent or its people and dialect
examples: The Kentish dialect has several unique words not found elsewhere in England
They served traditional Kentish ale at the village pub

definitions: state in the southeastern United States known for horse racing bourbon and bluegrass music
examples: Kentucky hosts the famous Kentucky Derby horse race every May
The rolling hills of Kentucky are perfect for raising thoroughbred horses

definitions: country in East Africa known for its wildlife safaris diverse landscapes and athletic runners
examples: Kenya attracts millions of tourists who come to see wildlife in its national parks
The Great Rift Valley runs through Kenya creating spectacular landscapes

definitions: native or citizen of Kenya or person of Kenyan descent
examples: The Kenyan runner won the marathon with a record-breaking time
Many Kenyans speak both English and Swahili as official languages

definitions: economist or person who supports the economic theories of John Maynard Keynes emphasizing government intervention
examples: The Keynesian economist argued for increased government spending during the recession
Many Keynesians believe that fiscal policy can effectively manage economic cycles

definitions: largest ethnic group of Mongols primarily living in Mongolia
standard dialect of Mongolian language spoken by the Khalkha people
examples: The Khalkha make up about eighty percent of Mongolia's population
Traditional Khalkha culture includes nomadic herding and horseback riding
Khalkha serves as the basis for standard Mongolian taught in schools
Most official documents in Mongolia are written in Khalkha Mongolian

definitions: collective body of initiated Sikhs founded by Guru Gobind Singh representing the pure ones
examples: Members of the Khalsa follow strict codes including wearing five symbols
The Khalsa was established in 1699 to protect religious freedom

definitions: indigenous people of western Siberia traditionally engaged in reindeer herding and fishing
Uralic language spoken by the Khanty people in western Siberia
examples: The Khanty have lived in the Ob River region for thousands of years
Traditional Khanty culture revolves around reindeer herding and river fishing
Khanty belongs to the Ugric branch of Uralic languages
Few young people still speak Khanty as their first language

definitions: capital city of Sudan located at the confluence of the Blue and White Nile rivers
examples: Khartoum serves as the political and commercial center of Sudan
The two Nile rivers meet at Khartoum creating a unique geographical feature

definitions: title of the viceroy of Egypt under Ottoman suzerainty from 1867 to 1914
examples: The khedive ruled Egypt with considerable autonomy from the Ottoman Empire
Ismail Pasha became the first ruler to officially hold the title of khedive

definitions: member of the dominant ethnic group of Cambodia
official language of Cambodia belonging to the Austroasiatic family
examples: The Khmer have inhabited the region for over two thousand years
Ancient Khmer civilization built the magnificent temples of Angkor Wat
She learned to speak Khmer during her volunteer work in Cambodia
Khmer script has its own unique alphabet with 33 consonants

definitions: indigenous pastoralist people of southwestern Africa historically known for cattle herding
examples: The Khoikhoi were skilled cattle herders who migrated seasonally for grazing
European colonists first encountered the Khoikhoi in the Cape region

definitions: collective term for indigenous hunter-gatherer peoples of southern Africa
group of African languages characterized by click consonants
examples: The Khoisan peoples are among the oldest inhabitants of southern Africa
Traditional Khoisan rock art can be found throughout the region
Khoisan languages feature unique click sounds not found in other language families
Linguists study Khoisan to understand early human language development

definitions: member of an Algonquian-speaking Native American people originally from the Great Lakes region
examples: The Kickapoo traditionally lived in wigwams and practiced seasonal migration
Some Kickapoo communities now reside in Kansas, Oklahoma, Texas, and Mexico

definitions: capital and largest city of Ukraine located on the Dnieper River also known as Kyiv
examples: Kiev has been an important center of Eastern European culture for centuries
The golden domes of Kiev's churches dominate the city skyline

definitions: highest mountain in Africa located in Tanzania near the Kenyan border
examples: Mount Kilimanjaro attracts thousands of climbers attempting to reach its summit
The snows of Kilimanjaro have been receding due to climate change

definitions: famous graffiti drawing and phrase from World War II showing a bald figure peering over a wall
examples: Kilroy was here became a popular message left by American soldiers
The Kilroy drawing appeared on walls and buildings throughout Europe

definitions: person who has great influence in choosing leaders especially in politics without seeking power themselves
examples: The media mogul became a kingmaker by endorsing presidential candidates
Several party kingmakers met privately to decide on their nominee

definitions: member of a Native American people originally from the southern Great Plains
examples: The Kiowa were known as skilled horsemen and buffalo hunters
Traditional Kiowa art includes elaborate beadwork and painted tipis

definitions: member of a Turkic people of Kyrgyzstan and surrounding regions also known as Kyrgyz
examples: The Kirghiz traditionally lived as nomadic herders in the mountains
Many Kirghiz still practice eagle hunting as a cultural tradition

definitions: island country in the central Pacific Ocean consisting of 33 coral atolls
examples: Kiribati faces serious threats from rising sea levels due to climate change
The International Date Line passes through Kiribati making it first to see each new day

definitions: Bantu language widely spoken in East Africa also known simply as Swahili
examples: Kiswahili serves as a lingua franca across much of East Africa
Many students in Tanzania learn Kiswahili as their primary language of education

definitions: flightless bird native to New Zealand with hair-like feathers and long beak
oval fruit with fuzzy brown skin and green flesh also called kiwifruit
informal term for a person from New Zealand
examples: The kiwi is New Zealand's national bird and appears on their currency
Conservation efforts have helped protect the endangered kiwi from extinction
She added sliced kiwi to the fruit salad for extra vitamins
The grocery store sells both green and gold varieties of kiwi
The kiwi accent is distinctly different from Australian pronunciation
Many kiwis enjoy outdoor activities like hiking and rugby

definitions: member of a Native American people traditionally living in southern Oregon and northern California
examples: The Klamath people historically lived along the Klamath River and its tributaries
Traditional Klamath basketry is highly valued for its intricate designs

definitions: secretive organization especially referring to the Ku Klux Klan known for racial hatred
examples: The klan held secret meetings wearing white robes and hoods
Civil rights activists worked to expose and oppose klan activities

definitions: region in Yukon Territory Canada famous for the gold rush of 1896 to 1899
examples: Thousands of prospectors traveled to the Klondike seeking their fortunes
The harsh Klondike winters claimed many lives during the gold rush

definitions: unicameral parliament of Israel consisting of 120 members elected by proportional representation
examples: The Knesset meets in Jerusalem to debate and pass Israeli laws
Members of the Knesset are elected every four years unless elections are called early

definitions: major port city in Japan known for its beef and recovery from devastating earthquake
examples: Kobe recovered remarkably from the devastating 1995 earthquake
The port of Kobe handles millions of tons of cargo annually

definitions: common dialect of ancient Greek that became the lingua franca of the eastern Mediterranean
examples: The New Testament was written in Koine Greek rather than classical Greek
Koine served as the common language for trade and communication across diverse regions

definitions: major city in eastern India formerly known as Calcutta serving as capital of West Bengal
examples: Kolkata was the capital of British India until 1911
The cultural heritage of Kolkata includes literature, art, and cinema

definitions: Finno-Ugric people native to the Komi Republic in northwestern Russia
Uralic language spoken by the Komi people with two main dialects
examples: The Komi have traditionally lived by hunting, fishing, and reindeer herding
Many Komi converted to Orthodox Christianity while maintaining folk traditions
Komi uses a modified Cyrillic alphabet for its writing system
Children in the Komi Republic can study Komi alongside Russian

definitions: Bantu-speaking people living in west-central Africa primarily in Congo, DRC, and Angola
Bantu language spoken by the Kongo people also known as Kikongo
examples: The Kongo kingdom was one of the most powerful states in central Africa
Traditional Kongo art includes intricate wood carvings and textiles
Kongo serves as a regional language in several African countries
Many Kongo words were carried to the Americas through the slave trade

definitions: central religious text of Islam believed by Muslims to be revelations from God to Muhammad
examples: Muslims believe the Koran contains the direct words of Allah
The Koran is divided into 114 chapters called suras

definitions: peninsula in East Asia divided into North Korea and South Korea since 1945
examples: Korea has a rich cultural heritage spanning thousands of years
The division of Korea remains one of the world's most tense borders
